intro: Romulea torta, commonly known as the twisted sandroot, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant has fibrous roots and is adapted to grow in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid environments. Its leaves are typically reduced to bracts, giving it a distinctive appearance. Romulea torta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well-suited for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
